statements.name: PROC GAM
statements.description: The GAM procedure fits generalized additive models as those models are defined by Hastie and Tibshirani (1990). This procedure provides an array of powerful tools for data analysis, based on nonparametric regression and smoothing techniques.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the SAS data set containing the data to be analyzed. If you omit the DATA= option, the procedure uses the most recently created SAS data set.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Reverses the sorting order of the classification variable (specified in the CLASS statement). If both the DESCENDING and ORDER= options are specified, PROC GAM orders the categories according to the ORDER= option and then reverses that order.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sorting order for the levels of all classification variables (specified in the CLASS statement). This ordering determines which parameters in the model correspond to each level in the data.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first in the order.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

arguments.name: PLOTS=
arguments.description: Controls the plots produced through ODS Graphics. Syntax: (1) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> = plot-request <(options)> (2) PLOTS <(global-plot-options)> = (plot-request <(options)> <...plot-request <(options)> > ) The global-plot-options apply to all plots generated by the GAM procedure, unless altered by a specific-plot-option. UNPACK specifies that multiple smoothing component plots that are collected into graphics panels be displayed separately. Use this option if you want to access individual smoothing component plots within the panel. The following listing describes the specific plots and their options. ALL requests that all plots are produced. NONE suppresses all plots. COMPONENTS | COMPONENT <(components-options)> requests the SmoothingComponentPlot that displays a panel of smoothing component plots. The following components-options are available: ADDITIVE requests that the additive component plots are produced for spline effects. The additive component plots combine the linear trend and the nonparametric prediction for each spline effect if its linear part is not specified explicitly in the MODEL statement. CLM includes confidence limits in the smoothing component plots. By default, 95% confidence limits are produced, but you can change the significance level by specifying the ALPHA= option in the MODEL statement. Note that producing these limits can be computationally intensive for large data sets. COMMONAXES specifies that smoothing component plots use a common vertical axis. This enables you to visually judge relative effect size.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Produces all available plots.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all plots.

arguments.name: COMPONENTS
arguments.description: Requests the SmoothingComponentPlot that displays a panel of smoothing component plots. Syntax: COMPONENTS<(components-options)> The following components-options are available: ADDITIVE requests that the additive component plots are produced for spline effects. CLM includes confidence limits in the smoothing component plots. COMMONAXES specifies that smoothing component plots use a common vertical axis. UNPACK specifies that the smoothing components be displayed individually.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement with PROC GAM to obtain separate analyses on observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables. If you specify more than one BY statement, only the last one specified is used.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: The CLASS statement names the classification variables to be used in the analysis. The CLASS statement must precede the MODEL statement.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Reverses the sorting order of the classification variable.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sorting order for the categories of categorical variables.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first in the order.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

arguments.name: TRUNCATE=
arguments.description: Specifies the length n of CLASS variable values to use in determining CLASS variable levels. If you specify TRUNCATE without the length n, the first 16 characters of the formatted values are used.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement names a variable that provides frequencies for each observation in the DATA= data set. Specifically, if n is the value of the FREQ variable for a given observation, then that observation is used n times.

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: MODEL event/trials=<PARAM(effects)> <smoothing effects> </options> ; The MODEL statement specifies the dependent variable and the independent effects you want to use in the model.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level, α, of the confidence limits on the final nonparametric component estimates when you request confidence limits to be included in the output data set. Specify number as a value between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.05.

arguments.name: ANODEV=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of method to be used to produce the "Analysis of Deviance" table for smoothing effects.

arguments.name: REFIT
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC GAM perform χ² tests by fitting nested GAM models. This is the default choice if you do not specify the ANODEV= option.

arguments.name: NOREFIT
arguments.description: Specifies that PROC GAM perform approximate tests of smoothing effects.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Requests that the procedure not produce the 'Analysis of Deviance' table for smoothing effects.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Reverses the order of the response categories. If both the DESCENDING and ORDER= options are specified, PROC GAM orders the response categories according to the ORDER= option and then reverses that order.

arguments.name: DIST=
arguments.description: Specifies the distribution family used in the model.

arguments.name: GAUSSIAN
arguments.description: Normal (Gaussian) distribution

arguments.name: BINOMIAL
arguments.description: Binomial distribution

arguments.name: POISSON
arguments.description: Poisson distribution

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Gamma distribution

arguments.name: IGAUSSIAN
arguments.description: Inverse Gaussian distribution

arguments.name: EPSILON=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for the backfitting algorithm. The default value is 1E-8.

arguments.name: EPSSCORE=
arguments.description: Specifies the convergence criterion for the local scoring algorithm. The default value is 1E-8.

arguments.name: EVENT=
arguments.description: Specifies the event category for the binary response model. PROC GAM models the probability of the event category.

arguments.name: 'category'
arguments.description: Event category for the binary response model

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: Designates the first ordered category as the event.

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: Designates the last ordered category as the event.

arguments.name: ITPRINT
arguments.description: Produces an iteration summary table for the smoothing effects when doing backfitting and local scoring.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the backfitting algorithm. The default value is 50.

arguments.name: MAXITSCORE=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations for the local scoring algorithm. The default value is 100.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies that the value of the smoothing parameter should be selected by generalized cross validation. If you specify both METHOD=GCV and the DF= option for the smoothing effects, the user-specified DF is used, and the METHOD=GCV option is ignored.

arguments.name: GCV
arguments.description: Specifies that the value of the smoothing parameter should be selected by generalized cross validation.

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the sorting order for the categories of categorical variables.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the order of appearance in the input data set.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the external formatted value, except for numeric variables with no explicit format, which are sorted by their unformatted (internal) value.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the descending frequency count; levels with the most observations come first in the order.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: Levels sorted by the unformatted value.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement creates a new SAS data set containing diagnostic measures calculated after fitting the model. All the variables in the original data set are included in the new data set, along with the variables created by specifying keywords in the OUTPUT statement.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the new data set to contain the diagnostic measures. This specification is required.

arguments.name: ADIAG=
arguments.description: Diagonal element of the hat matrix associated with the observation for each smoothing spline component.

arguments.name: ALL=
arguments.description: All statistics in this list.

arguments.name: LCLM=
arguments.description: Lower confidence limits for each predicted smoothing component.

arguments.name: LINP=
arguments.description: Linear prediction values on the link scale at design points.

arguments.name: PREDICTED=
arguments.description: Predicted values for each smoothing component and overall predicted values on the response scale at design points.

arguments.name: REDIDUAL=
arguments.description: Residual standardized by its weights.

arguments.name: STD=
arguments.description: Standard deviation of the prediction for each smoothing component.

arguments.name: UCLM=
arguments.description: Upper confidence limits for each predicted smoothing component.

statements.name: SCORE
statements.description: The SCORE statement calculates predicted values for a new data set. All the variables in the named data set are included in the OUT= data set, along with the predicted values.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies an input SAS data set containing all the variables included in independent effects in the MODEL statement.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of the SAS data set to contain the predictions.
